questions.text: What does God's creation of humans 'in His image' primarily teach us?
choices: We should look like God physically
We have inherent dignity and worth
We are perfect like God
We should create things
questions.explanation: Being made in God's image means we have inherent value, dignity, and worth as His creation.

questions.text: Why did God rest on the seventh day after creation?
choices: He was tired from working
To establish a pattern of rest for humans
He ran out of things to create
It was a mandatory holiday
questions.explanation: God's rest established the Sabbath principle, showing that rest is part of His design for human flourishing.

questions.text: What was the main consequence of Adam and Eve eating the forbidden fruit?
choices: They got a stomach ache
Separation from God and broken relationship
They became immortal
They had to leave the garden to find food
questions.explanation: Sin's primary consequence is broken fellowship with God, which affects all of humanity.

questions.text: What does Cain's question 'Am I my brother's keeper?' reveal about his heart?
choices: He was confused about his job duties
He was genuinely asking for clarification
He was deflecting responsibility for others
He wanted to find his brother
questions.explanation: Cain's question shows his attempt to avoid responsibility and reveals a heart hardened by sin and selfishness.

questions.text: Why did God flood the earth in Noah's time?
choices: To water the plants
Humanity had become completely corrupt and violent
To test Noah's boat-building skills
The earth was overpopulated
questions.explanation: The flood was God's judgment on pervasive evil and violence, while showing mercy to Noah's faithful family.

questions.text: What is the significance of God's covenant (rainbow promise) with Noah?
choices: Rainbows are pretty
God commits to never destroy all life by flood again
Noah was a good meteorologist
It was just a weather phenomenon
questions.explanation: The rainbow covenant shows God's faithfulness and His commitment to preserve creation despite human sin.

questions.text: What was wrong with building the Tower of Babel?
choices: The bricks were low quality
Human pride and attempt to reach heaven by own effort
The tower was too tall for safety codes
They didn't have a building permit
questions.explanation: Babel represents human pride and the attempt to make a name for ourselves apart from God.

questions.text: What does God's call to Abraham to leave his homeland teach us about faith?
choices: Moving is always good
Faith means trusting God even when we don't see the full picture
Abraham didn't like his family
Travel broadens your mind
questions.explanation: Abraham's obedience without knowing the destination demonstrates that faith involves trusting God's promises even when the path is unclear.

questions.text: Why did God ask Abraham to sacrifice Isaac?
choices: God was testing Abraham's faith and devotion
God needed a sacrifice
Isaac had done something wrong
It was a common practice back then
questions.explanation: God tested Abraham's faith to demonstrate complete trust, and ultimately provided a ram, foreshadowing God's own sacrifice.

questions.text: What does Jacob wrestling with God and receiving a new name teach us?
choices: Wrestling is good exercise
Persistence in seeking God transforms us
Cheating is okay if you win
God likes sports
questions.explanation: Jacob's wrestling shows that earnest pursuit of God leads to transformation and blessing, even when it's difficult.

questions.text: What is the main lesson from Joseph's story of betrayal and rising to power in Egypt?
choices: Dreams always come true literally
God can work all things for good, even betrayal and hardship
Brothers are always jealous
Egypt was a better place to live
questions.explanation: Joseph's story demonstrates God's sovereignty and faithfulness, turning evil intentions into good outcomes.

questions.text: What does Joseph forgiving his brothers reveal about God's character?
choices: Grudges are fine to hold
Forgiveness and reconciliation reflect God's heart
Family reunions are important
Money solves all problems
questions.explanation: Joseph's forgiveness mirrors God's grace and desire for reconciliation, showing that forgiveness is divine in nature.
